title: Search.ch
text:
search.ch is a <a href="search%20engine">search engine</a> and <a href="web%20portal">web portal</a> for <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a>. It was founded in 1995 by Rudolf Räber and Bernhard Seefeld as a regional search engine. In the following years many other services were added, such as a phonebook in 1999 and a free <a href="Short%20message%20service">SMS</a> service in 2000 (now reduced to only one free SMS per week).
The search technology is home grown. The user can restrict his search to regions of Switzerland, such as a <a href="cantons%20of%20Switzerland">canton</a> or a <a href="city">city</a>. The <a href="web%20crawler">web crawler</a> looks only at sites in the <a href=".ch">.ch</a> and <a href=".li">.li</a> <a href="top-level%20domain">top-level domain</a>s and a number of automatically and manually updated list of Swiss websites on other domains. The index is updated weekly.
